result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:09 AM Defendant Charellis D Mayhall not in court.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Charellis D Mayhall.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matters were scheduled for change of plea.
Defense is not sure why the deft is not here.
Deft also has a pending felony matter.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 24 hrs.

ADDRESS INFO for Charellis D Mayhall
Current: 1210 Albert St Upper, Racine, WI 53404 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 800 Park Ave #205, Racine, WI 53403

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ALSO $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:29 AM Defendant Charellis D Mayhall in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Charellis D Mayhall.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense has filed bond motions in both files.
Defense is asking that both bonds in each file be converted to a signature bond.
Defense is also requesting a change of plea date.
Deft has a pending felony matter.
State would not objecting to lowering the cash bond but objects to not having cash set.
BTC: Modify bonds to $50 cash and $500 signature on each case, all conditions remain, matters adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
